data.partBlankContent: The first 25 years of Grinnell's history saw a change in name and location. Iowa College moved far____ west fr__ Davenport, Iowa, to t__ town o_ Grinnell a__ unofficially ado____ the na__ of i__ benefactor: an abolit______ minister, Josiah Bushnell Grinnell, to wh__ journalist Horace Greeley suppo_____ wrote `` Go West, yo___ man, go West. data.fullContent: The first 25 years of Grinnell's history saw a change in name and location. Iowa College moved farther west from Davenport, Iowa, to the town of Grinnell and unofficially adopted the name of its benefactor: an abolitionist minister, Josiah Bushnell Grinnell, to whom journalist Horace Greeley supposedly wrote `` Go West, young man, go West. '' However, Greeley vehemently denied ever saying this to Grinnell, or to anyone. The name of the corporation "The Trustees of Iowa College" remained, but in 1909 the name "Grinnell College" was adopted by the trustees for the institution.
data.answer: 在格林内尔的前25年里，他的名字和地点都发生了变化。爱荷华学院从爱荷华州的达文波特向西迁移到了格林奈尔镇，并非正式地采用了其捐赠者的名字：一位废奴主义部长乔西亚·布什内尔·格林奈尔，记者霍勒斯·格里利(Horace Greeley)曾给他写过《往西走，年轻人，往西走》(Go west, young man, Go west)。然而，格里利坚决否认曾对格林内尔或任何人说过这句话。公司的名称“爱荷华学院的受托人”保留了下来，但在1909年，“格林内尔学院”被该机构的受托人采用。
